oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CRYSTALLIZATION CHARACTERISTICS OF VITROVAC-4040 (FE39NI39MO4SI6B12)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAJA, VS
RANGANATHAN, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: si-b alloys
metallic glasses
fe
kinetics
stability
behavior
fe80b20
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The metallic glass Vitrovac 4040 with the composition Fe39Ni39Mo4Si6B12 crystallizes in the order alpha-Fe, hexagonal Ni5Si2 and gamma-(Fe,Ni,Mo) by primary, secondary and polymorphic modes, respectively. The activation energies determined from the non-isothermal kinetics using Kissinger method turn out to be 490, 550 and 449 kJ.mol-1 for the above crystallization reactions. It has been observed that alpha transforms to gamma during annealing. Further, the bct (Fe1-xNix)3B phase has been identified when the glass is annealed above 1023 K.
